result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon Jules Thayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to probation today.
Concurrent with: Burnett County Case

miscConds.notes: No contact with L.M. (5/25/01), Karrie Mosay, J.M., S.M.J. (10/9/96), M.O.M. (12/8/05) subject through probation. May not vote until civil rights are restored. Voting rights may be different with tribe, may speak with tribe about those rights. May not hold public office while on status. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or other civil rights may also be lost.
Must give DNA sample but no surcharge. Sex offender treatment as prescribed and follow through. Undergo COMPAS Evaluation and follow through. Absolute Sobriety.
Must complete an AODA assessment and compliance.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

timeConds.notes: Conditional time banked for use by probation. Not subject to good time but subject to Work Release.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other case currently serving time

superMiscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Department of Corrections.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost if restored.  
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

CT finds elig for SA pgm & CIP.  3 yrs WSP, 1 yr IC, 2 yr ES, concurrent w/ other case currently serving time on.  Credit 329 days.  Fine/costs were previously ordered.
